countable.example: I bought two tomatoes for the salad.
She chopped a carrot for the soup.
We need five potatoes for this recipe.
I squeezed a lemon into my tea.
He ate three eggs for breakfast.
There are ten shrimps in the dish.
I cooked two chicken breasts for dinner.
She added a slice of cheese to her sandwich.
He ate a few cookies after lunch.
The recipe calls for three cloves of garlic.
I had two slices of bread for breakfast.
This dish needs six chili peppers to be spicy.

uncountable.example: Please drink some water every hour.
She poured a little milk into her coffee.
Add some oil to the pan before frying.
We use vinegar to make pickles.
Can you pass me some soy sauce?
I cooked a lot of rice for dinner.
He put too much sugar in his tea.
Add a pinch of salt to the soup.
Sprinkle some pepper on your pasta.
I spread a little butter on my toast.
We bought some cheese from the market.
The restaurant serves a lot of meat.
I love eating chocolate every day.
I added some honey to my tea.
